title: Linux resize Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to resize partitions and LVM volumes using the Linux resize command. Explore practical examples and step-by-step instructions to effectively manage storage space on your Linux system.

steps.title: Resize a Partition Using the resize Command

verify.name: Verify the partition resize
verify.hint: The output of the `fdisk -l /dev/sdb` command should show that the `/dev/sdb1` partition has been resized to 15GB.

steps.title: Resize an LVM Volume Group and Logical Volume

verify.name: Verify the LVM volume group and logical volume resize
verify.hint: The output of the `lvdisplay /dev/vg0/lv0` command should show that the logical volume `lv0` has been resized to 10GB.
